pandemic_simulator.viz.mplab_evaluation.plot_annotate_stages(exp_result: pandemic_simulator.data.interfaces.data_loader.ExperimentResult, ax: matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes) → None[source]¶
pandemic_simulator.viz.mplab_evaluation.plot_critical_summary(exp_result: pandemic_simulator.data.interfaces.data_loader.ExperimentResult, max_hospitals_capacity: int, show_variance: bool = True, annotate_stages: bool = False, ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None) → None[source]¶

Plot critical summary

Parameters

  • exp_result – ExperimentResult instance

  • max_hospitals_capacity – max hospitals capacity

  • show_variance – set to True to show variance along n-dim

  • annotate_stages – set to True to show annotations regarding stages

  • ax – figure axis handle

pandemic_simulator.viz.mplab_evaluation.plot_cumulative_reward(exp_result: pandemic_simulator.data.interfaces.data_loader.ExperimentResult, show_variance: bool = True, annotate_stages: bool = False, ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None) → None[source]¶

Plot cumulative reward

Parameters

  • exp_result – ExperimentResult instance

  • show_variance – set to True to show variance along n-dim

  • annotate_stages – set to True to add stage annotation

  • ax – figure axis handle

pandemic_simulator.viz.mplab_evaluation.plot_deaths_per_day_summary(exp_result: pandemic_simulator.data.interfaces.data_loader.ExperimentResult, show_variance: bool = True, annotate_stages: bool = False, ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None) → None[source]¶

Plot deaths per day

Parameters

  • exp_result – ExperimentResult instance

  • show_variance – set to True to show variance along n-dim

  • annotate_stages – set to True to show annotations regarding stages

  • ax – figure axis handle

pandemic_simulator.viz.mplab_evaluation.plot_global_infection_summary(exp_result: pandemic_simulator.data.interfaces.data_loader.ExperimentResult, testing_summary: bool = False, show_variance: bool = True, annotate_stages: bool = False, ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None) → None[source]¶

Plot global infection summary

Parameters

  • exp_result – ExperimentResult instance

  • testing_summary – set to True to display testing summary

  • show_variance – set to True to show variance along n-dim

  • annotate_stages – set to True to show annotations regarding stages

  • ax – figure axis handle

pandemic_simulator.viz.mplab_evaluation.plot_multi_params_summary(exp_results: Sequence[pandemic_simulator.data.interfaces.data_loader.ExperimentResult], param_labels: Sequence[str], max_hospitals_capacities: Sequence[int], show_testing_diff_plot: bool = False, show_time_to_peak: bool = True, show_cumulative_reward_plot: bool = False, show_pandemic_duration: bool = True, xlabel: str = '', axs: Optional[Sequence[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes]] = None) → None[source]¶

Plot multi params summary as bars

Parameters

  • exp_results – A sequence of ExperimentResult instances, one for each param

  • param_labels – A sequence of param labels

  • max_hospitals_capacities – A sequence of max hospital capacities for each exp result

  • show_testing_diff_plot – set to True to add a bar to denote the norm diff of testing summary from true infection summary

  • show_time_to_peak – set to True to add a bar to show time to peak for infection, critical and deaths.

  • show_cumulative_reward_plot – set to True to add a bar plot for the cumulative rewards

  • show_pandemic_duration – set to True to add a bar plot showing pandemic duration

  • xlabel – xlabel for all plots

  • axs – A sequence of figure axis handles
